section.title: Eclipse Jetty Release Notes
section.para: This release script is for jetty7, to release jetty8 the script is equivalent except instead of 'master' branch we use 'jetty-8' branch and instead of 'release' branch we use 'release-8'. To keep this clear in the steps below the actual git branch name is replaced with $ORIG_BRANCH and $REL_BRANCH.

listitem.para:
These follow a strict format and will be used when prompted during step
below.
listitem.screen: Release Version : 7.5.0.v20110901 (v[year][month][day]) Next Development Version : 7.5.0-SNAPSHOT Tag Name : jetty-7.5.0.v20110901

listitem.para: We use the 'release' branch to avoid problems with other developers actively working on the master branch.
Update the VERSION.txt with changes from the git logs, this populates the resolves issues since the last release.
Edit the VERSION.txt file to set the 'Release Version' at the top alongside the Date of this release.
Make sure everything is commit'd and pushed to git.eclipse.org
listitem.screen: $ git commit -m "Updating VERSION.txt top section" VERSION.txt $ git push origin $REL_BRANCH

listitem.para: codehaus-only, you also want to update the pom.xml to set the jetty-version property to the correct value and commit then push that as well.
NOTE: This step updates the <version> elements in the pom.xml files, does a test build with these new versions, and then commits the pom.xml changes to your local git repo.
NOTE: This step performs the release and deploys it to a oss.sonatype.org staging repository.
Set up files for next development versions.
Edit VERSION.txtfor 'Next Development Version' at the top. Do not date this line.
Make sure everything is commit'd and pushed to git.eclipse.org
listitem.screen: $ git commit -m "Updating VERSION.txt top section" VERSION.txt $ git push origin $REL_BRANCH

listitem.para: codehaus-only, you want to reset the jetty-version to another development version

listitem.screen: $ git checkout $ORIG_BRANCH $ git merge --no-ff $REL_BRANCH $ git push origin $ORIG_BRANCH
